title: How to Install a No Drill Mud Flap

steps.title: Make sure the wheel well and installation area where you plan to attach your new mud flaps is clean and clear of dirt, grime and debris.
steps.content: Make sure the wheel well and installation area where you plan to attach your new mud flaps is clean and clear of dirt, grime and debris.

steps.title: Turn your front wheels all the way to the left to maximize the clearance in-between the tire in the wheel well.
steps.content: Turn your front wheels all the way to the left to maximize the clearance in-between the tire in the wheel well.

steps.title: Next turn your mud flaps over to see where they are marked on the back.
steps.content: Next turn your mud flaps over to see where they are marked on the back. They should be marked L or LH for the left side and R or RH for the right hand side.

steps.title: The mounting holes used will be the ones that are currently factory drilled on your vehicle located in your wheel well.
steps.content: The mounting holes used will be the ones that are currently factory drilled on your vehicle located in your wheel well. Remove the screws, but hold onto them.

steps.title: With the screw removed, move your mud flap into place.
steps.content: With the screw removed, move your mud flap into place. You’ll notice it fits perfectly to the contours of your vehicle.

steps.title: Reinstall the screws into the holes you removed them from, attaching the mud flaps to the wheel well.
steps.content: Reinstall the screws into the holes you removed them from, attaching the mud flaps to the wheel well. Don’t fully tighten these yet.

steps.title: Take any additional screws and washers provided with the mud flap and attach them to the mud flap and screw them into any remaining holes left open.
steps.content: Take any additional screws and washers provided with the mud flap and attach them to the mud flap and screw them into any remaining holes left open.

steps.title: When attaching these additional screws, don’t forget to insert your hex nuts on in-between the mud flap and the wheel well if they were provided with your kit.
steps.content: When attaching these additional screws, don’t forget to insert your hex nuts on in-between the mud flap and the wheel well if they were provided with your kit.

steps.title: Before tightening your mud flap, adjust your mud flap to the angle you want it to be positioned.
steps.content: Before tightening your mud flap, adjust your mud flap to the angle you want it to be positioned.

steps.title: If your mud flap comes with additional holes and there is no available spot on your truck for a screw to enter, you will need to drill these holes out if you wish for extra stability.
steps.content: If your mud flap comes with additional holes and there is no available spot on your truck for a screw to enter, you will need to drill these holes out if you wish for extra stability.

steps.title: Follow steps 6-10 to complete the additional holes.
steps.content: Follow steps 6-10 to complete the additional holes.

steps.title: You have completed your first mud flap install.
steps.content: You have completed your first mud flap install. Repeat steps 3-11 for each additional mud flap installation.
